content: l s r ittle prouts in the ain by holly isaac --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- this pattern is written for self-striping yarn however you can stripe your own yarns as well if desired it can be worked either toe up or cuff down if done toe up i think the slipped stitches look like little sprouts if done cuff down they look like little droplets of rain size adult x-small small med med/large large x-large to fit about 7 7 5 8 8 5 9 9 5 inch foot circumference materials ❖ 100g light fingering weight yarn ❖ us size 1 2 25mm needle or size needed to obtain gauge ❖ stitch markers ❖ tapestry needle gauge 9 stitches and 12 row/inch in stockinette notes ❖ when more than one number is given the first applies to the x-small size the second to the small and so on ❖ the size of the sock can be adjusted by adjusting needle size and/or by using a lighter or heavier fingering weight yarn ❖ tester suggestion when using a self-striping yarn pick one with distinct color changes for every stripe to make it easier to see when to do the slip stitches abbreviations k knit p purl m1l make 1 left m1r make 1 right pm/sm place marker/slip marker ksw knit shadow wrap see note at end for instructions psw purl shadow wrap see note at end tksw/tpsw triple knit/purl shadow wrap see note at end k2tog knit 2 together ssk slip slip knit ©2022 holly isaac for personal use only hollyisaac on ravelry pattern support hollymocha3@gmail com 1 instructions cuff down instructions cuff using the german twisted cast-on or other stretchy cast on cast on 56 60 64 68 72 76 stitches join in the round being careful not to twist stitches knit 2 rounds for a cute mini rolled edge then work a 1x1 half-twisted rib for 20 rounds or desired length half-twisted rib round 1 knit 1 purl 1 round 2 knit 1 tbl purl 1 repeat rounds 1 and 2 for desired length if using a contrasting yarn for cuff cut now and start leg with mc leg work in pattern to desired leg length as follows when using self-striping yarn when a new color starts begin your slipped stitches note this will not always be at the beginning of round work the slipped stitches for 2 rounds this elongates the slipped stitches a bit more to make them more visible tester suggests marking the first slipped stitch of the color to help you keep track if it helps there is a chart at the end 56st 68st and 76st leg sl 1 knit 3 repeat around to the beginning of the color change then repeat for one more round continue in st st to the next color change on next color/stripe alternate the slipped stitches so that they look staggered as follows k2 the first stitch should be directly above a slipped stitch of the previous color change then sl
